intro: Pachites bodkinii, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature in the Apocynaceae family. Pachites bodkinii is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
